item.title: Jenna add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Jenna add a quote by John Russell
item.description: "Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting." -- John Russell

item.title: Jenna add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Life is easy to chronicle, but bewildering to practice." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I have noticed that rooms which are extra clean feel extra cold" -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Jenna add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Oh, it is wonderful to wake up in the morning with things to look forward to!" -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Banana Yoshimoto
item.description: "Sometimes people put up walls, not to keep others out, but to see who cares enough to break them down." -- Banana Yoshimoto

item.title: Jenna add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Some people go through life trying to find out what the world holds for them only to find out too late that it's what they bring to the world that really counts." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Joanne Harris
item.description: "I could do with a bit more excess. From now on I'm going to be immoderate--and volatile--I shall enjoy loud music and lurid poetry. I shall be rampant." -- Joanne Harris

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Marcel Duchamp
item.description: "I force myself to contradict myself in order to avoid conforming to my own taste." -- Marcel Duchamp

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Jenna add a quote by William Penn
item.description: "In all debates, let truth be thy aim, not victory, or an unjust interest." -- William Penn

item.title: Jenna add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "In order to be irreplaceacle, one must always be different." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "If you have but one friend, make sure you choose her well." -- Muriel Barbery

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "I thought: pity the poor in spirit who know neither the enchantment nor the beauty of language." -- Muriel Barbery

item.title: Jenna add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?" -- John Lennon

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone" -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Banana Yoshimoto
item.description: "People aren't overcome by situations or outside forces. Defeat comes from within." -- Banana Yoshimoto

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Robert Girardi
item.description: "His brain and his heart knew this, but he couldn’t stop himself, and the razor of his conscience lent the undeniable thrill of pain to the act." -- Robert Girardi

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "To go wrong in one's own way is better then to go right in someone else's." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Jenna add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "The armour of falsehood is subtly wrought out of darkness, and hides a man not only from others, but from his own soul." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Jenna add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "My Solitude is my Treasure, the best thing I have. I hesitate to go out. If you opened the little gate, I would not hop away—but oh how I sing in my gold cage." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: Jenna add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Why must people kneel down to pray? If I really wanted to pray I’ll tell you what I'd do. I'd go out into a great big field all alone or in the deep, deep woods and I'd look up into the sky—up—up—up—into that lovely blue sky that looks as if there was no end to its blueness. And then I'd just feel a prayer." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Jenna add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "True friends are always together in spirit. (Anne Shirley)" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Literature is strewn with the wreckage of those who have minded beyond reason the opinion of others." -- Virginia Woolf
